snippet: Hossam Taleb Yaacoub’s trial, on charges he participated in a Hezbollah plot to strike at Israeli tourists in Cyprus, ended Thursday.
abstract: Trial of Taleb Yaacoub, Lebanese man accused of scouting potential terrorist targets in Cyprus for militant group Hezbollah, ends with prosecution and defense sparring over contradictions between his testimony and statements he made in police depositions; Yaacoub's fate could influence whether European Union will list Hezbollah as terrorist organization.

byline.contributor: Andreas Riris contributed reporting from Limassol, Cyprus, and Christina Anderson from Goteborg, Sweden.

lead_paragraph: Hossam Taleb Yaacoub’s trial, on charges he participated in a Hezbollah plot to strike at Israeli tourists in Cyprus, ended Thursday.

headline.seo: Trial of Courier Tied to Terror Plots Pressures Hezbollah
headline.main: Trial of Courier Tied to Terror Plots Ends, Putting Pressure on Hezbollah
headline.print_headline: Trial of Courier Tied to Terror Plots Ends, Putting Pressure on Hezbollah
